item.title: [CRWD] More AI means a higher need for cybersecurity: CrowdStrike CEO
item.description: CrowdStrike Co-Founder and CEO George Kurtz sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi on Opening Bid for a conversation about the concerns around AI chatbot deployment and the role cybersecurity will have as more tech companies invest in building out AI data center infrastructure. Also watch George Kurtz discuss CrowdStrike's latest streak of acquisitions. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more&nbsp;Opening Bid.

item.title: [INTC] US futures sink after Trump warns of higher tariffs for 8 countries over Greenland issue
item.description: U.S. stock futures skidded Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to slap a 10% extra tariff on imports from eight European countries due to their opposition to his desire to take control of Greenland. The European countries targeted by Trump blasted the move, saying his threats “undermine transatlantic relations and risk a dangerous downward spiral.” The unusually strong joint statement from Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland was the most forceful rebuke from the European allies since he returned to the White House almost a year ago.

item.title: [AAPL] Hamptons reports fall in rents in 2025 for first time on record
item.description: Newly agreed rents across Britain fell by 0.7% in 2025 to an average £1,371 per month, according to Hamptons' latest letting index.

item.title: [AAPL] The Magnificent Seven Drove Markets. Now They’re Pulling in Different Directions.
item.description: The Magnificent Seven is now the Mag Five. Investors are no longer grouping the market’s big tech stocks together in quite the same way. The fortunes of what was once Wall Street’s favorite band of megacap names have diverged in the past year, as professional and ordinary investors alike take a more cautious view of the artificial-intelligence spending boom.

item.description: You might be wondering if Apple’s current share price still makes sense, or if the stock is starting to look expensive or interesting again based on the numbers.
